attributes.action: Suspend all MPs under Standing Orders 43, 44 and 45 of the House of Commons.
attributes.additional_details:
In protest against the outrageous conduct of Members of Parliament in the House of Commons, the British electorate order that all Members of Parliament be suspended for 5 days as set out in Standing Orders No. 43, 44 and 45 of the House of Commons, and while debating this petition, be required to publicly reflect on their shameful conduct, and collectively acknowledge their failure to serve the British electorate.

https://publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm201719/cmstords/1020/so_1020_180501.pdf
attributes.background: The British electorate table a vote of no confidence in our MPs and order they be suspended for disorderly conduct, for persistently & wilfully obstructing the business of the House to respect the result of the 2016 referendum to leave the EU, thereby failing to serve the British electorate.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

Standing Orders relating to conduct of Members are adjudicated by the Speaker of the House and not by debate. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
